content.description: Climb the slabby South Face of the formation, around the corner from the striking overhanging prow.  Jugs can be found the whole way up with a bit of meandering back and forth, however gear options are limited.
content.protection: Nuts and small cams.  Badly protected after the start except for a single solid nut placement halfway up.   Definite potential for a ground fall if the leader slips up.
content.location:
Belay at the bottom of the East Face and immediately climb to the left around the prow to the lower-angle South Face.  Continue straight up the center of the face.

Walk off to the west and around the south side of the formation.

content.description: Begin on the left of two small "pinnacles".  Climb up and move left over a bush.  Continue up left-ish (watch out for bees in a black hole !)  and finish up on the left side of the boulder used for TR-ing.
content.location: 5 ft left of the line of the "South Face" route

content.description:
Follow the sea of jugs up the slightly overhanging east face.

Crux is right off the ground and not very well protected.  Traversing left around the crux makes the route 5.6
content.protection:
Gear to 3" and slings.  Lasso the crux horn to protect the first moves.

10ft of webbing can be used to sling a boulder at the top for a bomber anchor.
content.location: Start below the obvious horn, go straight up and follow the crack system to the top.  Walk off to the west around the south side of the formation.
